question: Can I afford a house with a price of $350,000 given my annual income is $80,000 and my current debts are $15,000?
true_answer: Yes, you can afford a house priced at $350,000 with your current financial status. Down payment typically 5-20%.

steps.content: Can I afford a house with a price of $350,000 given my annual income is $80,000 and my current debts are $15,000?
Plan: 1) Initiate home_loan_agent for affordability analysis. 2) Calculate debt-to-income ratio. 3) Consider credit status. 4) Pass to supervisor for review. 5) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on affordability standards and down payment requirements.
Affordability depends on DTI ratio, typically should not exceed 36%. Down payments usually range from 5-20%.
Calculating DTI ratio based on income of $80,000 and debts of $15,000.
DTI ratio calculated as 18.75%, which is well below the 36% guideline.
Checking any additional factors affecting creditworthiness.
Credit status is good, no further issues detected.
How much would the down payment be?
Calculating typical down payment range for a $350,000 house.
Down payment ranges from $17,500 to $70,000, depending on loan type.
Review complete, all financial checks are satisfactory.
Yes, you can afford a house priced at $350,000 with your current financial status. Down payment typically 5-20%.
